I have a question, how exactly *do* you become a Moderator? Are you just randomly chosen? Are you sent a message like 'Great job on the forum, do you want to be a Moderator?'. Are you employees of SQUAD?

> 23 minutes ago, The\_Cat\_In\_Space said:
> 
> 
> I have a question, how exactly *do* you become a Moderator? Are you just randomly chosen?
> 

No, we're not randomly chosen. When the mod team decides we need new members, we get together and list candidates, and discuss each one. The users we think are the best choices are invited to become a moderator.

We do look for users with clean infraction histories. While an infraction is not an automatic disqualification, most of the moderators had less than 2.

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> Are you sent a message like 'Great job on the forum, do you want to be a Moderator?'.
> 

Yes. Mine said something almost exactly like that, but I can't share it because [@Badie](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/149302-badie/)'s not online to give me permission. (The rules apply to us, too. In this case, it's 2.2f.)

Really, though, it's not a half-bad guess. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> Are you employees of SQUAD?
> 

***No***! We're an all-volunteer team, with the exception of [@Badie](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/149302-badie/), the Community Lead. We don't receive any monetary compensation whatsoever from Squad or Take Two, although there have been the odd gifts of KSP merchandise as a way to say thank you. **We don't do this for money**, we do it because we love the community and want to contribute to it.

We did have to sign non-disclosure agreements before we received moderator permissions. Among other things, the NDAs protect your privacy, by preventing us from sharing  personal information, such as email addresses, birthdays, and real names.

> > > On 8/20/2017 at 8:11 PM, The\_Cat\_In\_Space said: > > > Are you sent a message like 'Great job on the forum, do you want to be a Moderator?' > Pretty much this. As you can imagine, it *really* matters that we don't make anyone a moderator who shouldn't be one. I don't just mean "avoid malicious people" (though obviously a "rogue" moderator would be a Very Bad Thing)-- it also calls for a variety of qualities. Long-standing and frequent participation in the forums (we want someone who will stick around, and who's around enough to be able to do the job). A wealth of evidence showing that they're dedicated to helping people. Great communicator. Not even a breath of a *hint* that they're someone who would go on a power trip. Most important of all, *even-tempered and unflappable*-- moderators *really* have to have a thick skin and be resistant to trolling, and someone who loses their cool when the flame starts flying is just not going to be able to handle things. It has to be someone who *cannot be goaded*, who can roll with the punches and not lash out. So basically, when we think we need more moderators, we get together and propose candidates. Someone will say, "Hey, how about So-and-so?" and the rest of the team goes "Oh yeah, that guy, can't believe we didn't make him a moderator long ago". It's usually a slam-dunk: someone who's really ready to be a moderator is generally pretty obvious. So when we have a consensus, then we reach out to the person (privately), see if they're interested (not everyone is-- it's a hard, unrewarding, often thankless job), and then go from there.
